p: So far all herbal compounds described are inhibitors, but lindoldhamine ( Figure 9g), a bisbenzylisoquinoline alkaloid extracted from Laurus nobilis, has been shown to generate sustained currents in both rASIC3 (EC 50 of 3.2 mM) and hASIC3 (EC 50 of 3.77 µM) expressing cells at pH 7.8, as well as greatly potentiating acid-evoked transient currents at pH 5.5 and 5.0, for rASIC3 and hASIC3, respectively [ 222]. Additionally, it was shown that potentiation of hASIC3 transient amplitudes by lindoldhamine (1 mM) was greater under basic conditions (pH 8.5 compared to 7.4).
